import React from "react"; import Accordion from "react-bootstrap/Accordion"; const Jobs = () => (

Want to join out team?

Let’s get one thing out of the way—working at Resilience Visitation isn’t always easy. We don’t take shortcuts and we routinely find ourselves involved in journeys of addiction, mental health challenges, and cycles of abuse. We work in a system that sometimes brings more challenges than support. Occasionally we get blamed for things we cannot control. If you’re looking for a job where you can just skate along, we’re not for you!

Of course, we also have the profound privilege of journeying with families through extraordinarily difficult circumstances. We support one another. We bear witness and offer support as people break the cycle of abuse and neglect. Equally, we bear witness as parents fail and as children face the consequences of their parents’ inability to break those cycles. Through professional training and our patient presence, we make a significant difference in many of these journeys. The challenges are daunting, but for us the rewards are greater. If that sounds like something you’d like to be a part of, take a look at our job descriptions below.{" "}

    {/*

    Resilience Visitation Bozeman, MT

    */}
    Family Connection Specialist Our Family Connection Specialists are established social services professionals who extend our mission of supporting families through their journeys of transformation that break cycles of abuse and neglect. These professionals are responsible for setting their own schedules as their partner with families. Family Connection Specialists receive training in at least one evidence-based model and manage their own caseloads. Family Connection Specialists are required to have at least a BA in a relevant field.
    • Pay: $18/hr+
    • Bonus pay for evenings/weekends
    • 5 paid holidays/yr for FT
    • Health benefits for FT
    • 3 weeks PTO/yr (at 40 hrs/week)
    • Access to professional mental health support for work related issues

      • SEND RESUME

      {" "}
    Family Connection Assistant Our Family Connection Assistants are generally getting their start in the social services field. They support our team as we walk with families by providing transportation, administrative support, and facilitating additional visits. Family Connection Assistants may also have opportunities to carry their own caseload and be trained in evidence-based models. Successful Family Connection Assistants will find themselves extremely well prepared for the Family Connection Specialist role. While Family Connection Assistants do get to manage their own schedules, some evening and/or weekend availability is needed as we strive to accommodate the work and school schedules of the families we serve.
    • Pay: $16+
    • Bonus pay for evenings/weekends
    • 5 paid holidays/yr for FT
    • Health benefits for FT
    • 3 weeks PTO/yr (at 40 hrs/week)
    • Access to professional mental health support for work related issues

      • SEND RESUME

      {" "}
    Family Connection Champions Our Family Connection Champions extend the reach of Resilience Visitation into their communities. These remarkable, self-driven individuals perform all the functions of a Family Connection Specialist while providing leadership for their local team. Many Family Connection Champions bring new evidence-based programs to our team or pioneer new geographic areas. In addition to bringing expertise in working with families, Family Connection Champions must be capable administrators and excellent communicators. They must embody our core values of offering dignity, practicing transparency, and fostering resilience. Family Connection Champions have at least a BA in a related field and 5 years of relevant experience. Candidates with an MA or the equivalent are preferred.
    • Pay: $20+
    • Bonus pay for evenings/weekends
    • 5 paid holidays/yr for FT
    • Health benefits for FT
    • 3 weeks PT/yr (at 40 hrs/week)
    • Access to professional mental health support for work related issues
    • Personalized incentives for team performance

      • SEND RESUME

      {" "}
{/*

    Job details

    Full-time

    Qualifications

    Experience:

  • relevant, 2 years (Required)

    • Education:

  • Bachelor's (Required)

    • Full Job Description

    Let’s face it. Parenting can be hard. There’s a reason people say “it takes a village.” Resilience Visitation is seeking a professional in social services ready to come alongside parents navigating the child welfare system. We support parents in 1.) recognizing and meeting their children’s needs, 2.) having regular opportunities to connect with their children in foster care and 3.) developing the discipline and skill they need to address the concern(s) that led to their children’s removal. This will be a FT position. Resilience Visitation is an innovative new provider of family visitation in Bozeman, Livingston, and the surrounding area. We are led by our shared commitment to fostering resilience, offering dignity, and practicing transparency. We work closely with Child and Family Services, foster parents, and other service providers to bring separated families opportunities to nurture relationships in the most natural setting possible and to support parents as they work toward their treatment plan goals. We are seeking the right individual ready to enhance our ability to impact our community. This candidate is eager to help us serve and enrich families who lose custody of their children. They understand that everyone has a story and they know that change is a slow process. They will strive to bring empathy to every situation, learn to see dignity in every individual, and consistently offer our families accountability and opportunities for growth. Successful applicants will have a good driving record and access to their own vehicle suitable for transporting children. Mileage on personal vehicles will be reimbursed. Candidates in the Bozeman and Livingston areas are encouraged to apply.

    Our full time Family Connection Specialists -set and manage their own schedules -get paid to commute to visits -receive training in Visit Coaching -receive other opportunities for professional development -build their professional network in Livingston and the Gallatin Valley -make a lasting difference for the parents and children they work with -receive PTO -receive health insurance

    Job Type: Full-time Pay: $15.50 - $17.00 per hour Benefits: Flexible Schedule Health Insurance Paid Time Off Experience: relevant: 2 years (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Work Location: Multiple locations This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is: Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneous Adaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in direction Autonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little direction High stress tolerance -- thrives in a high-pressure environment Company's Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/resiliencevisitation.org/?_tn=%2Cd%2CP-R&eid=ARAEtoXI7ZWTNDZ-uLBs9hzL8lZQYF0xztNXOCs-VNAa9JYUwUSwGE6BaMWe3UmOMJz724HfaCfPsZY Benefit Conditions: Only full-time employees eligible Work Remotely: No

      APPLY NOW
























*/}
); export default Jobs;
